titleStmt.title: Gädlä ḥawaryat, Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra (Maryam); names of the commissioners and their relatives; names of the scribes; three or five lines on the incipit page of a text, alternating with black lines; three or five lines in the incipit of a text, alternating with black lines; sometimes the initial lines of the account proper; elements of the Ethiopic numerals; elements of the punctuation signs.

msItem.note: - For each text, the equivalent pages of Budge’s Edition (BConAp I, II) and the abbreviations used by Bausi in Annali 2000-2001 are given here following:
I-1) BConAp I, 3-6; BConAp II, 2-3; Int in BauGaH
I-2) BConAp I, 7-36; BConAp II, 5-25; Pt1 in BauGaH

- According to the distribution of the texts, the Gädlä ḥawaryat ofMGM-007would belong to IV recension (cp. BauGaH, 84-85).
Text I-II, the “Martyrdom of St. Peter”, does not contain the “Discourse of Peter on the Cross” (= BConAp I, 45-49; BConAp II, 30-34).
- Some texts are repeated twice, probably copied from different models:
Text I-5 = Text I-30,
Text I-6 = Text I-31,
Text I-7 = Text I-32,
Text I-8 = Text I-33,
Text I-4 = Text I-34.

msItem.colophon: Fols. 155rb-vc: ተፈጸመ፡ በዝየ፡ ገድል፡ ዘ፲ወ፪ሐዋርያት፡ ወ፸ወ፪አርድእት፡ ... [fol. 155rc] በአኰቴተ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፩አምላክ፡ ተጽሕፈት፡ ዛቲ፡ ገድል፡ ዘ፲ወ፪ሐዋርያት፡ ወዘ፸ወ፪አርድእት፡ በ፸፻ወ፪፻፴ወ፬ዓመተ፡ ዓለም፨ በ፫፻፲ወ፰ዓመተ፡ ምሕረት፡ ዘውእቱ፡ ተረፈ፡ ቀመር፡ እንዘ፡ አበቅቴ፡ ፳ወ፫፡ ወመጥቅዕ፡ ፯በዘመነ፡ ማርቆስ፡ ወንጌላዊ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ … [fol. 155va] ዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘአጽሐፋ፡ ርእሰ፡ ርኡሳን፡ ኢዮብ፡ ዘስመ፡ ጥምቅቱ፡ ታዴዎስ፡ ዘሀገረ፡ መርጡለ፡ ማርያም፡ ወልደ፡ እኅቱ፡ ለዓቃቤ፡ ሰዓት፡ ዲዮስቆሮስ፡ … [fol. 155vc] ወጸሎተ፡ እለ፡ አምኑ፡ በቃላቲሆሙ፡ የሃሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁሮሙ፡ ታዴዎስ፡ ወምስለ፡ ብእሲቱ፡ ወለተ፡ ገብረ፡ መንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ወምስለ፡ ጸሐፊሁ፡ መርቆራዎስ፡ ወምስለ፡ አጽሐፊሁ፡ ጉንደ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ ፨ The first part of this note states that this "gädl" was written in 7234 year of the world, in 318 year of the mercy, on the 23th of ʾabäqte (epact) and on the 7rd of mäṭqǝʿ, in the time of Mark the Evangelist (= 1742 A.D; s. ChChron 168). The second part (fol. 155v) mentions the commissioner, ʾIyob, the “head of the heads”, whose baptismal name is Tadewos; he is said to be the son of the sister of ʿaqabe säʿat Diyosqoros and to come from the region of Märṭulä Maryam (a church in Goǧǧam). In the supplication formula at the end, Tadewos is mentioned again, together with his wife Wälättä Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus, the scribe Märqorewos and another individual, Gundä Haymanot, who is also mentioned as the commissioner of the book. The colophon states that the Ms. was completed in Yäkkatit, in his 12th year of the reign of King ʾIyasu (most probably ʾIyasu II, r. 1730-1755 [s. EAE III, 251-253] = ca. February 1742). The same date is mentioned in colophon 1. The note mentions also the name of the commissioner, Tadewos ʾIyob, and his “beloved” Wälätta Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus. His “children”, Rufaʾel and Wälättä Rufaʾel, and his teacher, ʾIyosyas from Märṭulä Maryam (in Goǧǧam), are also mentioned. At the end ʾAkalä Giyorgis is mentioned as the one who copied the Ms., together with all “the people of his house”. The note mentions also that the Ms. was purchased “in the Reign of Däbrä Ṣǝyon”, but it is unclear which are the names of whom purchased it (the commissioners?).

Fols. 202va-203rb: ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘተጽሕፈ፡ በመዋዕለ፡ መንግሥቱ፡ {ለ}መፍቀሬ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ንጉሥነ፡ ኢያሱ፡ {እም}ዘነግሠ፡ በ፲ወ፪ዓመት፡ ዘተመጥነ፡ በወርኃ፡ ኅዳር፡ ወተፈጸመ፡ በወርኃ፡ የካቲት፨ ዘአጽሐፈኒሰ፡ ዘንተ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ {ሐዋርያት፡} ከመ፡ ይኩ[fol. 202vb]ኖ፡ መድኃኒተ፡ ነፍሱ፡ ለፍቁሮሙ፡ ታዴዎስ፡ ኢዮብ፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቅርቱ፡ ወለተ፡ ገብረ፡ መንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ … [fol. 202vc l.5] በመንግሥተ፡ ደብረ፡ ጽዮን፡ ምስለ፡ እሊዓሁ፡ እለ፡ ሰምዕዎ፡ የሐይዉ፡ ለዘአጥረዩ፡ በንዋዮሙ፡ ለዘፈሐቆ፡ በሥልጣነ፡ ፲ወ፪ሐዋርያት፡ ወበሮወ፪አርድእት፡ … [fol. 203ra] ዝንተ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ገድሎሙ፡ ለሐዋርያት፡ ዘአጽሐፈ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ታዴዎስ፡ … ምስለ፡ ውሉዱ፡ ሣህለ፡ ሩፋኤል፡ ወወለተ፡ ሩፋኤል፡ ወምስለ፡ መምህሩ፨ ኢዮስያስ፡ ዘመርጡለ፡ ማርያም፡ ወዘአዕለወ፡ ፍካሬሁ፡ … አካለ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ ወኵሎሙ፡ ሰብ[fol. 203rb]አ፡ ቤቱ፡ … ለይኩን፡ ለኩን፨ ፨ ፨ The first part of this note states that this "gädl" was written in 7234 year of the world, in 318 year of the mercy, on the 23th of ʾabäqte (epact) and on the 7rd of mäṭqǝʿ, in the time of Mark the Evangelist (= 1742 A.D; s. ChChron 168). The second part (fol. 155v) mentions the commissioner, ʾIyob, the “head of the heads”, whose baptismal name is Tadewos; he is said to be the son of the sister of ʿaqabe säʿat Diyosqoros and to come from the region of Märṭulä Maryam (a church in Goǧǧam). In the supplication formula at the end, Tadewos is mentioned again, together with his wife Wälättä Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus, the scribe Märqorewos and another individual, Gundä Haymanot, who is also mentioned as the commissioner of the book. The colophon states that the Ms. was completed in Yäkkatit, in his 12th year of the reign of King ʾIyasu (most probably ʾIyasu II, r. 1730-1755 [s. EAE III, 251-253] = ca. February 1742). The same date is mentioned in colophon 1. The note mentions also the name of the commissioner, Tadewos ʾIyob, and his “beloved” Wälätta Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus. His “children”, Rufaʾel and Wälättä Rufaʾel, and his teacher, ʾIyosyas from Märṭulä Maryam (in Goǧǧam), are also mentioned. At the end ʾAkalä Giyorgis is mentioned as the one who copied the Ms., together with all “the people of his house”. The note mentions also that the Ms. was purchased “in the Reign of Däbrä Ṣǝyon”, but it is unclear which are the names of whom purchased it (the commissioners?).

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 203.0 folios, of which blank 203v, in 26.0 quires .
32.0 28.0 8.0

collation.signatures: Decorated - Decorated quires marks are written in the upper and bottom margin of the first and last fol. of each quire, each time twice: fol. 8v: ፩; fols. 9r and 16v: ፪; fols. 17r and 24v: ፫; fols. 25r and 32v: ፬; fols. 33r-40v: ፭; fols. 41r-48v: ፮; fols. 49r and 56v: ፯; fols. 57r and 64v: ፰; fols. 65r and 72v: ፱; fols. 73r and 80v: ፲; fols. 81r and 88v: ፲፩; fols. 89r and 96v: ፲፪; fols. 97r and 104v: ፲፫; fols. 105r and 112v: ፲፬; fols. 113r and 120v: ፲፭; fols. 121r and 128v: ፲፮; fols. 129r and 136v: ፲፯; fols. 137r and 144v: ፲፰; fols. 145r and 152v: ፲፱; fols. 153r and 160v: ፳; fols. 161r and 168v: ፳፩; fols. 169r and 176v: ፳፪; fols. 177r and 184v: ፳፫; fols. 185r and 192v: ፳፬; fols. 193r and 200v: ፳፭; fols. 201r and 203v: ፳፮.

supportDesc.condition: Some fols. (e.g. fols. 81v-82r, 109v-110r) are worn and affected by humidity. Fol. 203 is cut at the right edge.

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

handDesc.handNote: Mediocre. Black; red (vivid vermillion). ʾAkalä Giyorgis, Märqorewos.Märqorewos is mentioned as the scribe in colophon 1 and in the supplication formula on fol. 179vc. ʾAkalä Giyorgis is mentioned as the one who “copied” the Ms. in colophon 2 (might ʾAkalä Giyorgis be the baptismal name of Märqorewos?)Mid-18th century
Some distinctive features of the hand:
- the marker of the 3rd order is fairly long
- the tops of መ ሠ ወ (the 1st order) are slanted to the left
- numerals are written with several dashes above and below
- the top of numeral ፩ is slanted to the left (e.g., fols. 98ra, 98rb and 136vb)
- the numeral ፴ appears with the left loop open, raised above the ruled line (e.g. fol. 122vb)
- x-cross with dashes is used several times (e.g. fols 48rb, 50va).

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover, close to the head and the tail of the codex.
Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 6 tools were used: triple line fillet, double circle, interlaced line fillet, wave form, waffles, double sine wave with dots).

origin.origDate: According to colophons 1 and 2, the Ms. was written in the 12th year of the reign of King ʾIyasu II (= 1742 A.D.).

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: Two individuals are mentioned as commissioners, Tadewos ʾIyob (with baptismal name Tadewos) and Gundä Haymanot. Rǝʾǝsä rǝʾsan ("head of heads") Tadewos, of Märṭulä Maryam (a church in Goǧǧam), is mentioned, together with his wife Wälätta Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus, as commissioner in colophons 1 and 2. Both names are also written in the supplication formulas throughout the Ms. In colophon 2, “his children”, Rufaʾel and Wälättä Rufaʾel, and his teacher, ʾIyosyas of Märṭulä Maryam, are also mentioned. Gundä Haymanot is mentioned as commissioner in colophon 1.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
